Goodricke boost Cup hopes with win over Halifax

Goodricke seconds grabbed a vital win in their quest to take second spot in Group 1, beating Halifax thirds 2-0 this afternoon

Langwith worthy winners over Wentworth

A convincing win against a valiant Wentworth thirds set up a straight fight between Langwith and Halifax for the second qualification spot in Group 4

Vanbrugh seal qualification with five star display

Vanbrugh firsts clinched their qualification from Group 4 with a comfortable 5-0 victory over Alcuin seconds

Halifax seconds in seventh heaven against Derwent

Halifax seconds edged closer to confirming second spot in Group 4 with a 7-0 thrashing of Derwent thirds today

Cometh the hour, cometh the Mann as late goal breaks Vanbrugh hearts

A last minute winner from Joe Mann secured a vital win for Goodricke and inflicted a first defeat of the competition for Vanbrugh thirds

Spurling sets the tone as James seconds run riot

James seconds were in complete control of the game from start to finish, their superiority rewarded with five well taken goals against a beleaguered Alcuin thirds side

Halifax edge past Derwent seconds in close contest

Halifax firsts survived a late scare as they secured a narrow 2-1 win over Derwent seconds this afternoon

A Kimber Surprise sinks Vanbrugh

Alcuin firsts gave themselves a great chance of qualifying from Group Two after just doing enough to defeat a resilient and resourceful Vanbrugh seconds

Wentworth boost Plate hopes by beating Halifax

A match which looked set for stalemate following a particularly uneventful first half was brought to life by two Wentworth strikes soon after the restart

Voting open in York Sport Committee elections

Voting is currently underway to decide who will form next year's York Sport Committee

James hit Goodricke for six to continue winning run

James firsts' good form continued today, as they recorded yet another big win, beating Goodricke thirds 6-0

Vanbrugh seconds win to set up crunch match with Alcuin

On the final day of the third week of the College Cup 2012, Vanbrugh seconds made it two wins out of three, defeating Wentworth seconds 3-1

Goal-den Brown gives Alcuin that winning feeling

After a far from impressive opening two games, Alcuin firsts got their College Cup campaign back on track with an efficient, if unspectacular, victory over Goodricke thirds

Clarke magic secures James win over Halifax

A spectacular hat-trick from talisman Tom Clarke helped James to a hard-earned 4-1 win over Halifax fourths today

Stevenson stars as Halifax thirds close in on qualification

On a sweltering JLD, Halifax thirds were impressive in defeating Langwith seconds 2-1

Wentworth finally off the mark against Goodricke

In sweltering conditions, Wentworth firsts twice came from behind to earn a good draw against Goodricke seconds, keeping alive their hopes of qualification for the Plate

Captain Kirk beams Derwent up

An early goal from David Kirk set Derwent on their way to a comfortable 5-0 win over James thirds this afternoon

Cricket firsts win emphatically in derby game

A mammoth score of 368 saw the UYCC firsts take a 206 run victory in the last 16 of the cup

Derwent thirds shine in defeating Alcuin seconds

On a sun drenched JLD, the contest between Derwent thirds and Alcuin seconds definitely felt the effects of the soaring temperatures and energy sapping conditions

Taylor-made victory for Vanbrugh

Vanbrugh firsts produced another confident display to knock eight past Wentworth Thirds on a sweltering JLD

Langwith leave it late to beat Halifax

Langwith firsts scored two stunning second half goals, as they came from behind to beat Halifax seconds on a sunny JLD

Petrolheads

Dan Holland speaks to the Karting Club about the thrill-seeking sport and their future prospects

Brilliant week ends in promotion for York City

York City capped off a wonderful week by securing promotion back to the Football League with a 2-1 win over Luton Town at Wembley in Sunday's Blue Square Bet Premier play-off final. (Thumbnail credit Peter Iveson)

College Cup living up to expectations

With exam season in full swing and dissertation deadlines passing, sport has seemingly taken a backseat after the frantic nature of Roses 2012 in Lancaster

The Untouchables take early Fantasy Football lead

Half way through the group stages of the College Cup 2012 and this year's Fantasy Football league is starting to take shape. Nouse takes a look at some of the best and worst performers so far.

Pre-tournament contenders turn up the heat in College Cup

With College Cup 2012 now two weeks in, the teams that started the competition as favourites have begun to justify that status. (Thumbnail credit Hoagy Davis-Digges)

Derwent Nock down James with consummate ease

Jon Garness grabbed a brace as an unfancied Derwent seconds claimed their first College Cup goals and first win

Take That! Vanbrugh show patience to beat Barlow

Vanbrugh Thirds continued to defy the doubters today on the JLD, maintaining their 100% record at the expense of their Alcuin counterparts

A Happy Mundy for Halifax firsts as they defeat Goodricke

This afternoon saw the clash of the titans in Group Three as Goodricke firsts took on last year's winners Halifax firsts

Vanbrugh thirds scrape past James in entertaining affair

Vanbrugh thirds squeezed past James in a very even match on a cold JLD with Vanbrugh substitute James Robinson scoring the decisive goal to win the match
